        public void simultaneousSpeechBeforeNormalization()
        Interpolation before normalization (i.e. with words linked to utterances) and with two simultaneous linked utterances by different speaekers.

      • utteranceTags

        public void utteranceTags()
        Dangling utterance tags don't interfere with partitioning. This test ensures that utterance meta-data (word count, rate, htk timestamp, etc.) doesn't interfere with word interpolatation even if the meta tags are imperfectly linked, e.g. if the end anchor is not the same. (Ideally, such tags should be strictly 'parallel' to the utterance, but the reality of graph validation, merging, normalization, etc. is that sometimes they're de-linked.)

      • overlappingInterpolation

        public void overlappingInterpolation()
        Test words uttered by different speakers are interpolated independently.

      • padForAnnotationsOnOtherLayers

        public void padForAnnotationsOnOtherLayers()
        Interpolation works across linked annotations from other layers.

      • extraneousLayers

        public void extraneousLayers()
        Test independent annotations from other layers don't interfere with interpolation.

      • fragmentWithMissingAnchors

        public void fragmentWithMissingAnchors()
        Fragments extracted from larger graphs can have annotations with anchors that are not in the fragment; test that they're ignored.

      • partialAlignmentOfUnalignedFragment

        public void partialAlignmentOfUnalignedFragment()
        Test partial alignment correction scenario, where only one anchor among default-aligned anchors is manually aligned.

      • chainedSubWordAnnotations

        public void chainedSubWordAnnotations()
        Ensure chained sub-word annotations (e.g. grammatical words within orthographic words) get offsets.

      • chainedSubWordAnnotationsAfterRealignment

        public void chainedSubWordAnnotationsAfterRealignment()
        Ensure aligned chained sub-word annotations (e.g. grammatical words within orthographic words) get re-aligned after forced/manual alignment.

      • multipleOverlaidSubWordLayers

        public void multipleOverlaidSubWordLayers()
        Ensure multiple aligned chained sub-word annotations (e.g. grammatical words within orthographic words) don't interfere with each other.
